repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
A lot of functions in move.c only worked for curwin, alternatively took a `wp` arg but still only work if that happens to be curwin.

Refactor those that are needed for update_topline(wp) to work for any window.

fixes #27723
fixes #27720

comment_data.body: It goes deeper still, `getvpos->coladvance2->inserted_bytes->changed_bytes...` all operate on `curwin` as well ðŸ™ˆ
might need a restructure, coladvance2 can be used to both change text or just update the cursor, and those usecases need to be separated.
The `mark_mb_adjustpos()` in this function should use `wp->w_buffer` instead of `curbuf`.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -540,7 +540,7 @@ void getvcol(win_T *wp, pos_T *pos, colnr_T *start, colnr_T *cursor, colnr_T *en
     if (ci.chr.value == TAB
         && (State & MODE_NORMAL)
         && !wp->w_p_list
-        && !virtual_active()
+        && !virtual_active(curwin)

comment_regular_data.body: Or maybe `hasFolding()` can take a `wp` argument, but `hasFoldingWin()` remains unchanged as it is a bit verbose (has two more arguments).
That sounds good, many existing calls can be updated to the shorter form as well.
It seems that a `nvim/types_defs.h` is needed in `nvim/state.h`.

title: fix(api/buffer): fix handling of viewport of non-current buffer
